sentences.english: He declares war on the kingdom of Westmarch.
sentences.chinese: 然後他又向威斯特瑪王國宣戰。

sentences.english: Considered an attack against democracy, the assassination caused the government to _declarewar on the yakuza.
sentences.chinese: 這被看做是對民主的攻擊，政府正式對暴力團宣戰。

sentences.english: Did somebody declare war on trees without telling me?
sentences.chinese: 有人沒和我招呼一聲就對樹木宣戰了嗎？

sentences.english: The king was prepared to levy war on his neighbour after their quarrel over the land.
sentences.chinese: 國王與領國與鄰土之爭以後，就準備對鄰國宣戰。

sentences.english: Hence, as the organizers explained, books burning of this time aimed to raise the social awareness, and declare war on "spirit rubbish".
sentences.chinese: 公開燒書就是爲了警醒社會，向“心靈垃圾”宣戰。

sentences.english: President Adams did not call for a declaration of war, but hostilities began at sea.
sentences.chinese: 亞當斯總統並未宣戰，但是戰爭在海邊一觸即發。

sentences.english: Crusaders declaring war on Byz every time they pass their lands fixed.
sentences.chinese: 十字軍向拜占庭宣戰，修正了他們的行走路線。

sentences.english: It was used to describe members of Congress who declared war on Britain in 1812.
sentences.chinese: 這個詞用於描述1812年對英國宣戰的國會議員。

sentences.english: As soon as war was declared,many men volunteered.
sentences.chinese: 一經宣戰，就有許多人自願參軍。

sentences.english: Under the constitution, the legislative branch has the exclusive right to declare war.
sentences.chinese: 根據美國憲法，國會是美國唯一擁有宣戰權的機構。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, Sweden in July 1741 declared war on Russia.
sentences.chinese: 這時候，瑞典在1741年7月對露西亞宣戰。

sentences.english: 1939 - Canada declares war on Nazi Germany.
sentences.chinese: 1939年的今天，加拿大向納粹德國宣戰。

sentences.english: To be represented at the founding conference in San Francisco, states had to have declared war on the axis powers beforehand.
sentences.chinese: 出席舊金山成立大會的國家必須曾向軸心國宣戰。

sentences.english: 1914 - Japan declaresd war on Germany and bombed Qingdao, China.
sentences.chinese: 1914年的今天，日本向德國宣戰並轟炸中國青島。

sentences.english: Congress is vested with the power to declare war.
sentences.chinese: 國會被賦予宣戰的權力。

definition: to start a war/to make war/to battle against
to resist/to make a stand and fight (against)
to start/to launch/to unleash/to mobilize/to arouse
